name: Brook Chimney House Hotel

reviews.text: We were welcomed on arrival and given all relevant details. Rooms were great, although there were only 3 beds in the family room and we required 4. We attended a family wedding and the day was absolutely wonderful. The staff went out their way to ensure all the guests were happy, inparticular the event co-ordinator. The wedding food was delicious and we enjoyed breakfast the following day too.
reviews.title: Our experience of attending a wedding inc a stay over at Chimney House Hotel

reviews.text: Thank you for making us feel welcomed and we are so pleased we chose to stay over rather than travelling home.
reviews.title: Run by children!!

reviews.text: Stayed here with customers, as usual hotel was full. Food was poor to say the least. Disgusting smell (drains) in the hallway. Was told it was a nearby farm... but you could not smell it outside!! The very young staff ( I remember my mother saying when policemen look young thats when you know you are old, is it the same for Hotel staff?) are like robots, friendly enough but cant solve a problem. bless em. Over all I will not stay there again especially with customers.
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel with unrealised potential

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night and were rather disappointed, especially with our dinner. The room was large and clean and there were no real problems except a lack of a TV control and poor water pressure in the shower. The hotel is a nice building with good grounds but a lot more could have been made of the gardens. It was as if no one looked after the area with inadequate garden furniture - we never saw anyone with a responsibility for the grounds at all. Our dinner was disappointing, especially when you think that they must have qualified chefs. The starter pate was very drab, with slimy onion chutney and solid stale olive bread while in the main course, the breast of chicken was over cooked and hard. The tomato sauce which covered it was mass produced . The sweet course of apple pie probably came in a lorry that morning, and did not leave any lasting memories. Drinks at the table, the wine and the beer especially, were hideously over priced and nothing less than a rip off. All in all, the Chimney House flatters to deceive - it has a lot of potential but someone in charge needs to get a grip.
reviews.title: Review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Reception staff both incoming and out going very helpful and pleasant. Restaurant/bar staff pleasant young people. The only drawback we had was the lack of a children's menu. The meal we received was reasonably priced, nicely presented and breakfast was excellent as were the breakfast staff. We had a 3 year old with us and he was accommodated very well by all the staff. Would note that the safety catches on the windows had been partially removed therefore were non effective - not very good for children.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wedding Venue!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel last night as part of a 2 night break purchased as a gift for my birthday.
reviews.title: So awful we checked out early

reviews.text: On arrival we were told that we needed to book for dinner as there was a wedding and they were busy, even though they couldnt tell us what was on the menu. Asked for a copy of the menu to be sent to the room so we could decide and it never arrived so we went out instead.
reviews.title: Great little hotel, fantastic food and very helpful staff

reviews.text: Our keycard didnt work and I had to return to reception.
reviews.title: Attention To Detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was shabby, not particularly clean, stain on the bath mat, no remote for the tv and was situated right next to the stairs with a banging door. The wallpaper was peeling off and there were marks all over the walls. Didnt look like the rooms on the website.
reviews.title: An efficient small hotel perfectly set just off the motorway

reviews.text: We were kept awake all night by the noise on the stairs and the banging door. Also each bedroom door slams shut so makes a loud noise. Because there was a function people were going up to bed late so we were disturbed all night. Not great when you have booked a relaxing weekend away.
reviews.title: a bad experience

reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights with a group on a business trip. We moved from another hotel to this one as the previous booking had no room service facilities and we knew we would be returning late each day. The hotel is pleasant and the staff very helpful and friendly. Due to work commitments I only ate breakfast which was fine. We returned late each night to find no room service available. We were promised some warm food (burgers) one night but it didn't happen. The bar had limited drinks available and the night porter didn't know how to change a barrel. We asked if we could watch the cricket in the bar one night but the tv wasn't working. As there are no other leisure facilities it was disappointing The worst thing about the hotel was my room. It was comfortable and clean enough but had a terrible smell. I couldn't decide if it was a smoking room that had never been properly cleaned or if it suffered from damp. There was an airfreshener ( empty) plugged in so the staff clearly recognised the problem. I didn't complain as my colleagues all had similar problems A great shame as the staff were great. A little more attention to detail and effort to accommodate our needs and we would have returned on our next trip. I'm sure the hotel can I'll afford to lose a booking of 15 or so guests over minor details. Overall not too bad when paid for by work but would have checked out early if I had stayed for a personal visit
reviews.title: Sadly a bit of a let down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: sixth visit and again it was great. great welcome, great service, great staff, fantastic meals. lovely hotel very clean freindly and welcoming. "we will be back"
reviews.title: our favourite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped off here on the way to the lakes. The service was very good, and the food was excellent. Stay in an executive room if possible.
reviews.title: Super food, great service

reviews.text: We got married at The Chimney House in June, and had a perfect day. All staff worked hard towards ensuring we had a wonderful day, everything was so smoothly done, we didn't have to worry about a thing. A special thanks to the manager who after one of the best men had arrived witha bow tie instead of a cravat, went into Sandbach to a mens hire shop to get a cravat from there to match the other best mans, he even took it back after the wedding, this was fantastic customer service. The wedding breakfast was gorgeous, lots of compliments from out guests. We used the hotel based DJ for the evening do, he was really good. The whole day went without a hitch and would definately recommend The Chimney House.
reviews.title: A perfect day

reviews.text: oh dear a little disapointing the main areas reception, bar, dinning area great. the check in very smooth, the staff were great and the breakfast brilliant. But the bedrooms were not great there were a few of us staying and everyones room was very tierd. Most rooms had no hair dryer our room had obviously had damp the wallpaper was missing in areas and falling off the walls in places. the windows surrounds were covered in milldew. the bathroom had cobwebs on the ceilling, someone elses hair on the floor, the towels were marked with milldew and make up and the shower had no water pressure it was a trickle. the general cleanliness was ok in the room but round the edges and the bathroom let it down which was a shame because the rest of the hotel was fine and the breakfast was well worth it lovely.
reviews.title: oh dear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on the way up to Scotland with our dog. We had an amazing dinner, bed & breakfast rate. I have to be honest we were not expecting much!
reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise!!
Daughters Wedding
reviews.text: We arrived later than expected due to shocking traffic on the M6. The staff could not have been more helpful, showing us to our room, carrying cases, making much of the dog. We went straight down for dinner. Well........it was absolutely fantastic. The food was delicious and the staff delightful. Had an ok nights sleep, the problem being the ridiculously hard bed. But other than that it was a great place to stay and we will definitely be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My daughters wedding was the most fantastic day the staff at the reception were on the ball anything we wanted they catered for especially Nathan the only thing that went wrong was a few people who pre booked rooms hadnt got them they were sorted in the end but took the shine off also booked two rooms one normal for my son and one executive for myself and my husband we didnt get one and when complained was told they hadnt got any left you cant change a special day so i was disapointed with the reception staff otherwise wonderful
reviews.title: Great hotel but with a drawback

reviews.text: Stayed for the one night. Purchased a drink before dinner and paid cash. Had a lovely evening meal and the restaurant staff very pleasant. Room not exactly bright but clean although the windows were a little black around the edges. Next morning went to pay and was charged for drinks that we did not have. I produced my receipt from the night before and was told alright then they would remove the others from my bill but was made to feel as though I was trying to pull a fast one. Spoilt the stay and couldn't stop thinking about it all the way home.
reviews.title: Nothing Special....

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location, not far from Crewe and fairly easy to get too. Check in was quick however due to inefficiency. Non of the hotels facilities (be them limited) were explained. Of course it is their choice not to try and upsell however breakfast times, restaurant opening times etc were not explained or pointed out. We appeared to have one of the updated rooms (32) however this still wasnt of a very high standard at all. The room was damp, smelt very, very musty and had a non-functioning television which was also extremely dated. The bathroom was ok but water pressure was very, very low and shower would either run very hot or very cold. Bar prices and prices of food are quite reasonable and what you would expect of a small, 3 star hotel in this location however I feel for the product, the price of the rooms is way too high. They don't have any extra amenities such as toiletries, minibar, hairdryer etc (perhaps this was just our room) and for the price the hotel overall was not as clean as I would have liked.
reviews.title: excellent food, service, telephone UK & WI FI free

description: This Tudor-style building is in quiet gardens, 500 metres from junction 17 of the M6 motorway. It has free parking, a stylish restaurant, a bar and free Wi-Fi in the public areas.The brasserie-style Patio Restaurant is open for lunch and dinner. The Chimney House hotel also has a modern bar offering light bar meals and snacks.There are regular buses to Congleton, Sandbach and Crewe. Hotel Rooms: 50.
